headline: Awful
pros: There are no pros to this place
cons: Worst place I've ever worked at

headline: Used to be a great place to work at
pros:
Good company events, good atmosphere
Lower management is friendly and easy to work with
cons:
Upper management is unstable- many many waves of firing people and then re-hiring over and over. No appreciation for people's lives.
Non-competitive compensation- much lower than the market average.
Client base is "unpleasant"- basically thieves and scammers looking to make a quick $ using Leverate's technology. Many of my former clients were in prison.
Very rigid when it comes to remote working. One day a week.

headline: Leverate
pros:
Fun and Great People
Open to new ideas from employees
cons: Not advanced in tech and strict

headline: good company- bad management
pros: good reputation - strong brand - good people
cons: bad management decisions - don't read the market right

headline: Layers and losers!
pros: They make you feel good and then they stab you in the back and kick you away.
cons:
Very low pay, very disconnected CEO,.
They believe we are stupid and will by any bs they say.. no more!

headline: 4 my best years working anywhere
pros:
The company employs many good people.

Great culture.

 Management is always open to listen to new ideas.

Friendly atmosphere.
cons:
Monthly pay could be better.

Little bit chaotic, "israeli like" type of management

headline: Amazing place amazing people
pros: I place to grow in
cons: Game of thorns, mainly because of the crazy dynamics

headline: Amazing place to work at
pros: Professional company, fantastic people and atmosphere
cons: Still waiting for Playstation 5

headline: e
pros: good people, good vibes, close to home
cons: not very good terms and salary

headline: Compliance
pros: Friendly environment and smart people
cons: Cannot really find any cons

headline: Choose another oke
pros: Experience networking exposure paid on time
cons: Bad management disrespectfull no values

headline: Great
pros: Great Work life balance. Nice team
cons: Not enough processes set to grow and learn more

headline: Horrible backstabbing culture
pros: Good place to start if you are new to the industry and market.
cons: Horrible backstabbing culture where FEAR is pervasive. The vast opportunity to improve and learn is hindered by the system implemented. You don't get what you are promised from when you signed up and join them. Employees are becoming more aware of how bad the situation is at Levirate and are leaving at an astonishing high rate.

headline: Amazing company
pros: Very friendly environment, great staff,great working condition
cons: No gym in the building

headline: Part of my DNA
pros: People, personal growth, opportunities, strategy
cons: Takes time to break the walls (but always find a window to break throughl

headline: A great and dynamic company to work for
pros:
Great environment
A lot of challenges
Every day there is something new
cons: The offices do not reflect the atmosphere

headline: I do not enjoy the culture there
pros: Meeting new people, obtaining new knowledge.
cons: Misleading would be the best way to describe the onboarding and overall culture at this company. No communication, no guidance, no proper training and no job security. If you are brilliant with integrity and vision, do not waste your time working at this place.

headline: Positive
pros: No Micromanagement and Flexible working hours.
cons: no work from home policy

headline: Great People
pros: Great people and atmosphere in the office
cons: not sharing management no opportunity to grow

headline: Going nowhere
pros: Being a broker is great if you're into thinking on your feet.
cons: This job was fine at first and slowly morphed into a truly unbearable situation in less than a year. Upper management is disconnected and middle management is generally useless. Systems are outdated, expectations are lacking in communication and they don't care about employees input. High staff turnover in the last few years.

headline: It disturbs your inner peace
pros: It was good at first, till you get to that point.
cons: The pay you get is not enough to compensate the work you do. including the headache and the stress. There's too much going on and it disturbs your inner peace. Then you know it's time to leave.

headline: No real sense of direction
pros: If you just need something temporary, this is the ideal place. Not a long term career path though.
cons: There is no real sense of direction within the company and no system in place that supports the business needs. Goals and targets are consistently not being met, causing frequent changes to how teams operate. Not a favorable working environment for any potential employees or for anyone looking to join the firm. Save your time and work elsewhere.

headline: Over fatigued from the daily grind
pros: The company events are generally fun and it's a good way to get people together.
cons: Most employees here are over fatigued from the daily grind and overly competitive atmosphere. Teams are being set against each other and it gives too much pressure to each individual.

headline: review
pros: Positive working environment throughout the departments
cons: Distance between offices can be challenging

headline: Better leave this place as soon as you can
pros: They have interesting products, and employees are good to work with.
cons: Employees here are being overworked despite having low salaries. You'll surely lose your dreams of having a good life once you work here. Management doesn't acknowledge or appreciate the employees, much more give them a reward for their diligence at work. Better leave this place as soon as you can.

headline: A lot to lose and not much to gain
pros: I was lucky to be able to work with my team and enjoy the team building with them.
cons: There's a lot to lose and not much to gain in this company. Sure, you have the experience and pay, but that's because you worked for it.But you lose your time for yourself cause no matter how long you've been working in the company, your pay and position remains the same.You lose time for your family from the overtime you have to do just to give their demands.You lose your health from the stress and pressure from the management.

headline: No workplace culture
pros: I got to work on and lean different technologies
cons: The management is blissfully unaware of the fact that a company needs good workplace culture to unite employees and help them bond. As a result, there is not enough communication between the teams, which leads to communication gaps and often impacts the work. Also the management rarely shares its plans with the employees. Overall, there is a lack of trust.

headline: Two Critical Problems
pros: Many tech Gurus work at this place
cons: Two critical problems of this company are the lack of a better plan for the future and incompetent middle management. It is a bad combination as it's forcing many competent, energetic and loyal employees to quit.

headline: Middle Management Rules this Place
pros: The company provides a bonus if middle management is favorable to an employee.
cons: The middle-management is the problem here. They push the junior employees to their limit. If they like someone, that person can just sit in the office the entire day and do nothing, and no one would say a word to that employee. If they dislike someone, they make him or her work all the time without any breaks. It's disgusting.

headline: Good times and bad times
pros: Good vibes, nice perks like company-wide vacation to Cyprus and a yearly bonus
cons: Management sides with mid-level managers abusing their power and staff

headline: Poor Management
pros: This place is full of energetic people.
cons: Unorganized and unsystematic processes. This place is poorly managed. Projects are pending, efforts and hard work are being wasted because of chaotic management. Employees don't know which project to focused on. It's confusing and frustrating to work in a place where the goals are unclear and you don't know what the company's objectives are.

headline: This company is going nowhere
pros: The tech here is great. The work environment is also filled with energy due to the energetic employees.
cons: Management lacks any clear direction, and the company has no clear set of goals. Employees have no idea what management is trying to aim for. We are just made to do whatever the managers instruct us to do. There's also no job security. Some of my co-workers before got fired for without adequate warning. This company is going nowhere.

headline: Do something to hit targets
pros: We have a good team, schedule can be flexible and work can be interesting.
cons: The system is falling apart from the lack of coordination between upper and middle management. Goals are not being met, targets are not being hit, plus the entire industry is not at its best.

headline: FOREX TECH PROVIDER
pros: Pleasant staff, friendly atmosphere, nice place
cons: Most company's clients are forex companies, this industry is now down, so Leverate company has not it best times

headline: Tech Sales and Business Development
pros: A large company with interesting tech products for the brokerage sector
cons: Executive and Middle Management are not well informed nor are in a position to provide clear vision and direction to other departments, hence falling short on achieving target and objectives.

headline: Love to work there
pros:
Salary is fair 
Work place with lots of benefits
Promoting from inside 
Interesting work schedule and balanced work place
cons: Non - it’s a super exciting and vibrant work place

headline: Leverate could be a great jump for your career
pros: Overall, this is a great company to work for. The technology is great, the people are professional and nice, and the management believes in the personal growth of their employees.
cons: While being only a technology provider, the domain is mainly Forex. Some people may not find this appealing.

headline: Great place to work
pros: Open-minded management, opportunities for promotions, good for young and ambitious people
cons: Still start up mode

headline: Leverate's been enjoyable since day one
pros: I've really enjoyed it there since I was hired, my coworkers are absolutely amazing and management is pretty kind as well. The work is consistently busy but not too hard, and upper management isn't stingy with raises. I plan to be here for a long time.
cons: I'd like more team building opportunities outside of the office.

headline: Solid experience all around
pros: Leverate provided a great opportunity for me and I've been really thankful for the chance to work with the name as respected as theirs. My team is really dedicated which makes everything easier and I've gotten to work with some very impressive clients.
cons: Hard work is expected, I think it's the same thing with other companies.

headline: No longer leading company
pros:
Location is fine. 
Few colleagues  are fun and nice. 
Salary is reasonable.
cons:
Company turned to be boring.  The management is "milking the cow"  with the legacy products and there is no technological challenge anymore.  
The most talented employees are leaving the company and no one will replace them. 
CEO wants to lower the risk and to reduce the expenses / resources. 
The fact that they are in problematic industry is also something you want to consider!

headline: Review
pros: the People there are awesome
cons:
Bad management
Do not go near this place

headline: Good company to work for

- Great salary
- Smart people, friendly people
- Good working environment
cons: The type of industry is not the best

cons: Didn't like the business model

headline: Turned from great to bad
pros:
Had great technology
great culture
interesting domain
cons: the company is in it way to being close

headline: Shady industry - Unstable management.
pros:
1.Great employees.
2.I left leverate because of the management , the forex filed that makes a lot of illegal things (managment). 
3.My advice - go to the gaming or the security industry at hi-tech- NOT THE FOREX INDUSTRY
cons:
1.Awful management 
2.Forex and Binary are disappeared from the world, more and more regulation and It gets harder and harder to bring new clients.
3.Every six months they cut employees.
4. Many illegal things  
5. I believe that the company will survive at least 1 or 2 years

headline: Software Developer
pros: Nice offices, Some good people
cons: Forex is bad, too involved CTO,

headline: Leverate review
pros: Great environment, great people. interesting products
cons: salary was low and benefits were lacking
